The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#16834](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16834.html) (Fetch Headers over DNS by TheBlueMatt)
* [
I think we wanted to include some of the environmental entropy sources (statistics, pid, ...) that OpenSSL uses in our own RNG state first. See #10299. I'll PR something soon.
Concept ACK.\n\nI recently ran into openssl issues here https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/17123, this is awesome !
Concept and code review ACK, agree that we should ideally get #17270 in first.
Concept ACK\n\nVery pleased to see OpenSSL go :)
Fixed doc nit above and squashed some commits together. This is waiting on #17270.

### Gitian builds | File | commit 397c6d32c8f8a20a3605ef0d51d159adc21fd125
(master) | commit e585117b8cbf55a5a24e69daa46213eb85e3ca97
(master and this pull) | |--|--|--| | bitcoin-0.19.99-osx-unsigned.dmg | [`bd2b4ba1fdf14cc3...`](https://drahtbot.space/gitian/bitcoin/bitcoin/397c6d32c8f8a20a3605ef0d51d159adc21fd125/bitcoin-0.19.99-osx-unsigned.d
concept ACK, is libsecp256k1 going to remove OpenSSL as well? It uses $CRYPTO_CFLAGS
@sidhujag libsecp256k1 only uses OpenSSL as an optional dependency in tests. This may change in the future, but the same reasons really don't apply.

it doesn't affect any of the bitcoin core binaries, so it's off topic here. Please take your question upstream.\n(That said, cross-checking against other libs is generally a good idea for cryptographic libraries.)
note: Will update 5cc4f20c7064fee90a78a827a9e30b2934ce4ca7 to change `WAIT_LOCK` to `Mutex`.
